justification: The article recommends “bottom-up coding schemes” for reliable behaviour description, citing “ChimpFACS, Vick et al., 2007,” which is a specific instrument for coding facial expressions in chimpanzees.
In the same sentence the authors list “ChimpLASG, Zulberti et al., 2024” as another bottom-up coding scheme, indicating it is used to code or measure the repertoire of chimpanzee gestures.

Discussing the DGS Corpus, the paper notes that “pose estimation data… generated using OpenPose… enables detailed research into the kinematic characteristics of multimodal signals,” linking the construct (kinematic properties) with the measurement tool (OpenPose).
